## Load packages

```{r setup, include=FALSE}

## initial code to rbind the datasets

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(pacman)
p_load(readr, tidyverse, ggmap, devtools, scales, broom)
```


## Load in the data

```{r data, include=FALSE}
crime2021 = read_csv("CrimeData-2021.csv")


crime2020 = read_csv("CrimeData-2020.csv")


crime2019 = read_csv("CrimeData-2019.csv")
```

## Merge the two datasets

```{r bind}

crime2019 = crime2019 %>% select(-c(OpenDataX, OpenDataY))

#total1 = rbind(crime2021,crime2020)

total1 = rbind(crime2021,crime2020, crime2019)

```

## Format the date, add month column to do seasons later

```{r month}

#format the date column in total1

total1<- total1%>% mutate(date = as.Date.character(total1$OccurDate, format = "%m/%d/%Y")) 


#add a months column
total1 = total1%>%mutate(month = months(date))

##turn month into a name
total1 = total1%>%mutate(month = match(total1$month, month.name))
```

## Create seasons to check out the data

```{r seasons}                        
                         
#create a seasons variable
total1 =total1%>%
  mutate(
    season = case_when(
      month %in% 10:12 ~ "Fall",
      month %in%  1:3  ~ "Winter",
      month %in%  4:6  ~ "Spring",
      TRUE ~ "Summer"))

view(total1)
```

## GGplots of all offenses and only larceny offenses

```{r figure1}
#glimpse(total1)

#ggplot of all offenses by season

offense_gg <- total1%>%ggplot(aes(y=OffenseCategory, fill=season))+geom_bar() +
  xlab("Total Offenses") + ylab("Types of Offenses") + ggtitle("Portland Total Offenses by Season, 2019-2021")

offense_gg

#ggplot of larceny offenses by season


offenses_season <-total1%>%filter(OffenseCategory =="Larceny Offenses")%>%ggplot(aes(y=OffenseType, fill=season))+geom_bar() +
  xlab("Total Larceny Offenses") + ylab("Types of Larceny Offenses") + ggtitle("Portland Larceny by Season, 2019-2021")

offenses_season
```

## COVID and Crime

```{r rd}
covid_data = filter(total1, between(date, as.Date("2019-03-15"), as.Date("2021-03-15")))

covid_data$crime_count <- ave(as.numeric(covid_data[[1]]), covid_data[["date"]] ,
                                                     FUN=length)

cov_plot <- ggplot(covid_data, aes(date, crime_count)) + 
  geom_point(colour = "firebrick", size = 2, alpha = 1/5) +
  geom_vline(xintercept=as.numeric(as.Date("2020-03-15")), linetype = "longdash") + 
  geom_smooth() + 
  xlab("March 2019 to March 2021") +
  ylab("Crimes per Day") +
  scale_color_discrete(name = "COVID-19 in Portland",
                       breaks = as.numeric(as.Date(c("2020-03-15", "2020-03-16"))), labels = c("Pre-COVID", "COVID"))

cov_plot

```

```{r covid}

precovid = filter(total1, between(date, as.Date("2019-03-15"), as.Date("2020-03-15")))

covid = filter(total1, between(date, as.Date("2020-03-16"), as.Date("2021-03-16")))


precovid$crime_count <- ave(as.numeric(precovid[[1]]), precovid[["OccurDate"]] ,
                                                     FUN=length)

covid$crime_count <- ave(as.numeric(covid[[1]]), covid[["OccurDate"]] ,
                                                     FUN=length)

options(ggplot2.continuous.colour="viridis")


precovid_plot <- precovid %>% ggplot(aes(x=date, y=crime_count, fill=CrimeAgainst)) + geom_col() +
  xlab("One Year Pre-COVID") + ylab("Pre-COVID Daily Number of Offenses") + ggtitle("Pre-COVID Portland Total Offenses, Mar 15, 2019 - Mar 15, 2020") 

precovid_plot 


covid_plot <- covid %>% ggplot(aes(x=date, y=crime_count, fill=CrimeAgainst)) + geom_col() +
  xlab("One Year COVID") + ylab("COVID Daily Number of Offenses") + ggtitle("COVID Portland Total Offenses, Mar 16, 2020 - Mar 16, 2021") 

covid_plot 

```
